thread.title: Kurt Cobain's Unreleased Solo Recording of 'Sappy' Arrives Online
thread.title_full: Kurt Cobain's Unreleased Solo Recording of 'Sappy' Arrives Online

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Kurt Cobain's Unreleased Solo Recording of 'Sappy' Arrives Online
text:
Comments The early demo version of Nirvana's track is officially unveiled ahead of the release of 'Kurt Cobain - Montage of Heck: The Home Recordings'. 
More than two decades since "Sappy" was released, Nirvana fans are now treated to the first official listen to Kurt Cobain 's early demo version of the song. The rough solo version recorded by the late frontman of the band is more haunting and poignant than the catchy song released under the title "Verse Chorus Verse" on 1993's compilation album " No Alternative". The demo version of "Sappy" will be included on the companion album to HBO's documentary " Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck ". The soundtrack, "Kurt Cobain - Montage of Heck : The Home Recordings", will be released on November 13, the same day the critically acclaimed movie will be released on DVD and Blu-ray. The soundtrack will also include Cobain's cover of The Beatles ' "And I Love Her". The standard version will include 13 tracks from Cobain's personal collection, while the deluxe edition double-LP vinyl will boast 31 tracks. The deluxe edition will be hitting the shelves on December 4. Both versions of the soundtrack will be available digitally.
